DEMO: Blocking Inbound and Outbound Cyberthreats

In this demo learn, how Arbor Edge Defense automatically blocks both inbound and outbound threats essentially acting as a first and last line of defense at the network edge.

DEMO: Protecting Digital Infrastructure

Use North/South and East/West visibility across your entire digital infrastructure (e.g. in this demo we'll show a legacy network and AWS cloud) to detect, investigate, and mitigate cyber threats.

DEMO: TestStream Lab Manager Overview

Automating a test lab provides an organization the opportunity to test devices, applications, and services faster. Learn how to Improve the performance of your test labs with NETSCOUT solutions.

DEMO: Visibility in VMware NSX-T Environments

Eliminate blind spots with a seamless view for complete visibility and monitoring of application performance and service assurance in VMware NSX-T environments.

How to Manage Service Triage in a Virtual Network

Proactively manage the performance of digital infrastructure.

DEMO: Supporting the VDI-Based Remote Worker

Deliver a superior user experience for remote workers and VDI services.

DEMO: Unified Communications & Collaboration Services

Combat poor performance, under-utilization, application unavailability, and service disruptions to your UC&C services.

DEMO: Multi-Cloud Environments (VMware, AWS)

Achieve outstanding customer experience across your hybrid environment.

Remote Working Changes Are Here to Stay—Are Your Network Vulnerabilities?

DDoS attacks broke records in 2020, thanks to COVID-19, surpassing 10 million. With remote work looking to be a permanent choice for many workers, businesses must find permanent, distributed network security solutions that protect their people and their service performance.

4 Post-Pandemic Cybersecurity Trends

Cyberattackers are taking advantage of shifts in business connectivity, finding new ways to exploit security vulnerabilities. This evolving threat environment makes it necessary to increase cybersecurity vigilance.

Streaming Services Are in the Crosshairs

Media companies globally are being increasingly targeted by DDoS attacks. Politically motivated campaigns and extortion requests threaten this critical component of every country’s infrastructure. Your business is at risk. Free speech is at risk. Are you protected?

Increased Online Reliance Opens Door to Cyberattacks

In 2020, service providers managed enormous spikes in legitimate network traffic such as streaming video, video conference calls, and gaming while simultaneously defending a huge increase in DDoS attacks targeting critical network infrastructure and services.

A Guide to NetOps and SecOps Collaboration

This white paper draws on EMA research to offer a step-by-step guide for building partnerships and collaboration between enterprise network and security teams

What is a Bot?

A bot – which is short for robot – is a software application programmed to execute specific tasks as part of another computer program or to simulate human activity. Bots are designed to automate tasks on their own without human intervention, thus eliminating cumbersome manual processes.

Ensuring Cloud Migration Success

As enterprises lift and shift applications from on-premises to public cloud platforms, it is critical that users have reliable access and high performance throughout and after the migration.

The Beat Goes On

The beat goes on: Threat actors launched approximately 2.9 million DDoS attacks in the first quarter of 2021, a 31% increase from the same time in 2020.

What is a VPN?

A Virtual Private Network (VPN) is an extension of a private network across a public or shared network that allows users to send and receive sensitive data as securely as if the connection was completely within a company’s private network.

How Can Cybersecurity Leaders Better Navigate the Post Breach Response?

Alex Stamos and Phillipa Leighton-Jones discuss how enterprises can better navigate and respond to security breaches with network visibility, transparency, and gathering sufficient data to reduce the impact of intrusion.

A United Front: How NetOps and SecOps Can Improve Security

Network infrastructure and security concerns are converging. As DDoS, ransomware, and malware attacks continue to proliferate, NetOps and SecOps teams need to work together to ward off cyberattacks.

Improving Financial Services Technology Performance With Service Edge Visibility

This financial services leader successfully processes millions of business transactions every day, which has made the company a household name across the globe. This company is a long-time NETSCOUT customer, years ago standardizing on nGeniusONE as their service assurance platform of choice.

What is IIoT?

IIoT refers to a subcategory of the broader Internet of Things. IoT includes IIoT plus things like asset tracking, remote monitoring, wearables, and more. IIoT focuses specifically on industrial applications such as manufacturing or agriculture.

What is a Hybrid Network?

Any computer network that uses more than one type of connecting technology or topology is a hybrid network.

What is Edge Cloud?

The term Edge Cloud refers to virtual and cloud-based technologies that are used in the RAN for network, compute, and storage for user plane applications and services.

TsuNAME Zone Cyclic Dependency-Induced Recursive DNS Query Cascade

In mid-May 2021, security researchers at SIDN Labs, InternetNZ, and USC/ISI released a research paper describing a sabotage-based DDoS attack methodology dubbed ‘TsuNAME’ that targeted authoritative DNS server.

What is Beamforming?

The 5G capability called beamforming is the ability to concentrate bandwidth over a focused area such as pop-up hospital, allowing health care workers to quickly adapt, monitor, and change treatments for patients.a

What is Sniffer?

Packet sniffing is a technique whereby packet data flowing across the network is detected and observed. Network administrators use packet sniffing tools to monitor and validate network traffic, while hackers my use similar tools for nefarious purposes.
